intro: Guatteria novogranatensis, commonly known as the Colombian guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in Colombia and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
